utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Hi Lynnette this is participant number eleven.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And can I have your name please?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yah, this is participant number eleven.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, and how can I help you?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yah I'm planning to have %um- to go around Asia and Singapore is at the top of my list.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And what attractions can I go in Singapore?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh which part of the year are you planning to come?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um maybe this %um last week of May.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And how many people are coming with you?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay and ha- %uh okay, what do you and your friends like to do?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um for me, I like to know about the culture, history and of course historical places in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The last one, what did you say?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um it's the historical places in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So %uh you like to see culture, history-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So we have like the Chinese culture.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Hm Lynnette, I have a question because %um I was kinda- Yes?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: For the culture side, we have %uh the Chinese culture.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: We also have the Indian culture.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So which one should I introduce you first?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I would like to introduce you to the Chinatown %uh of Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, I'm just going to show you, this is just one picture of Chinatown.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes and are there a lot of souvenirs in Chinatown in Singapore?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: There are souvenirs available but they will be all %uh Chinese related kind of souvenir.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So this is just one street scene in Chinatown.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah, this is just a street scene in Chinatown.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And then when the people in the past come to Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh they all live near the Singapore River.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So Chinatown is actually just next to the Singapore River.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Their houses, you could see are more elaborate.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright, some of these houses have carvings outside their houses.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh and it will be a little bit different from the other culture.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: The houses in the Chinatown, how- what year they were built?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: More- most of these Chinatown houses, I would say they are in the range of about a hundred twenty years now.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: They were- yah, they we're built in the early nineteen hundreds.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So the different- and the Chinese are also divided into various dialect speaking.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Hm would it be the Mandarin one or %hm the two- what's this?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh languages will be both spoken and written.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So %uh dialect meaning it's just spoken language.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So this people, they came from China and they live in %uh various so-called %uh provinces in China.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So when they come here %uh not every one of them would speak Mandarin.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So they will still be just speaking in their %uh dialects.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So when they came here, they still live in different street %uh in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Is Chinatown the- one of the most visited places?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh I would say it's a popular spot for tourist to visit.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: If you want to learn, to see the Chinese %um houses.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh where do the Chinese %uh used to live %uh in the past.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And there are some pictures on your right-hand side.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: These are just some old photograph of %uh Chinatown.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes, is that %hm a horse or- what's this?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay. This is actually %uh a bullock cart.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay. This is actually %uh a bullock cart.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah, in the past, they don't have %uh motor vehicles.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Motor vehicles came later part of the years.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So they started using bullock cart to transport their goods.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh and %uh yah, mainly for transportation of goods.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: For people, they would be using the trishaws.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh so this is the scene %uh what you can see in Chinatown.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And you also mentioned about history, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh do you want me to introduce you to %uh a museum in Chinatown?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: We have a museum in Chinatown and %uh this museum is called the Chinatown Heritage Centre.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes, are there- is there a show in that Heritage Centre?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh there is no show but there are some %uh TV programmes that you can stop to see.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It is not a very big museum.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So there are no cultural shows?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, so- %Uh no culture show for this %uh museum.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It is housed inside a shop house.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, so you can see the layout of the first level.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So it's a three level building.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: There's only a lift but the lift is quite small.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So it's accessible by the MRT.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So these are just some of the things that you'll be looking at inside the %uh- %uh inside the %uh museum.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So %um yes, Lynnette, %um I have a question.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um because %uh Singapore is neighbouring Malaysia, Indonesia, Thailand.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Hm I want to know who are the ancestors of Singaporeans.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh in the beginning %uh there were actually some native Singaporeans who live here.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh there were about thousand of them.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And %uh we do have %uh- back in the past, we were actually part of the Mahajapit forces based in Indonesia.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And %uh well, things were going fine.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: We had kings to rule us.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: They were about five of them.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh the first king of Singapore is called Sang Nila Utama.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And he %uh named us Singapura from Temasek he renamed us as Singapura %uh and that's how Singapore gets its name.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Now the last king of Singapore, because he was pursued by his %uh enemies.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And he went over to Melaka setup and other kingdom there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So we do not have any more kings here.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And so it was pretty quiet out here again until the year of eighteen nineteen when Raffles came to Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So when he came here, we have approximately about a thousand people living here.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's the- %uh Raffles is from %uh Britain.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So he came here because he was %uh working for the British East India Company.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Now, when he came here, later on he decided to make Singapore into a free port.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So from then on, many people from all over the world started to come here.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And to seek for employment as well.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh so there are people from all over the world coming here.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: For example, we have people from the nearby Malay archipelago area.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So the Malay archipelago, we will be talking about the Indonesian %uh islands.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh we are %uh- so basically nearby to Singapore, we call this the Malay archipelago.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And we also have people coming from China.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: We also have people coming from Europe.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And we have people coming from the Arab countries.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So the main group of people would be from these countries.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh so it's a mix of races.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Hm I saw here that you have a relic temple.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So there are a lot of things to do in Chinatown.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh the Buddha Relic Temple is just located in Chinatown.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And you could do those temple when you are going down to Chinatown.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So I'm going to show you again the image of the Buddha Relic Temple.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes, so %uh Lynnette, I have a question.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So we can walk through the- through Chinatown and through this %um other attractions from another to- from other attraction to- for example Chinatown and it's neighbouring attractions.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: This is all %uh built %uh just in Chinatown itself.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright, it's not just one street.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So it's actually consists of quite a number of lanes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh and one of the attractions %uh you are thinking of visiting is this Buddha Relic Temple.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You can walk inside but there is a dress code.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh dress code, you will have to be appropriately dressed.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Cute like I mean, sorry, %uh cargo pants %uh just will be fine.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh singlet of course is not appropriate %uh dress code for %uh visiting any places of worship here.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Hm are there a lot of people worship in that temple?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: There are local people who goes in %uh to do their prayers %uh during the opening hours of the temple.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh so %uh you will see, yes, worshippers going in to worship.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But otherwise %uh most of the time in %uh Chinese temples %uh it will be more crowded when %uh- like on special days.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh the first day and the fifteenth day of the Chinese calendar which is different from the Western calendar.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And of course during the Buddha.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, you will find that %uh more people would be worshiping %uh otherwise it's %uh- well that is- it's not that crowded to visit the Buddha relic temple.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Hm so it's quite a walk when I go around Chinatown %hm. Would- Can I-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh if you are thinking of taking the MRT, it is just about three lanes away.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So %uh I think %uh it again depends on whether you want to visit %um %uh it's it all depends whether you want to visit the Chinatown Heritage Centre.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: If you were planning to do that, then you have to allocate about one hour in the- at Chinatown Heritage Centre or minimum forty minutes I would say.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The Buddha Relic Temple approximately %uh twenty minutes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh walk through some of the lanes probably would take you about %uh one and a half hours.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So well, you can spend easily half a day just doing %uh these few places.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So I can go around for half a day and visit all the places in Chinatown.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So do you want to eat some %uh Chinese food in Chinatown?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Do you want to go to a restaurant?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Or you want to do just %uh non-air conditioned food places?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh do you know this food called Chinese dim sum?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So these are just some %uh like %uh small little food and they normally steam them in a bamboo container.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Otherwise you- there are also some dishes that is fried.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh so that would be something that you can get %uh in Chinatown.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %hm what about the night life in Singapore?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Night life in Singapore, I would like to recommend you to this- are you talking about clubs?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, we have a very famous club.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh yes. The- especially the younger people and the young at heart.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, we have a very famous %uh club in Singapore and we call it Zouk.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Have you heard of this name before?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Have you heard of this club?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, these are just some of the scene %uh in the club.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: As you can see it's very crowded.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, so these are- lots of beautiful people over there to see and to be seen and party.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So this is one of them.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Is this %uh till twelve o'clock or just from midnight to- till morning?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Now our %uh hours- our party hours %uh we properly finish around three A.M.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Where is- it doesn't go through throughout the night.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, so this is one of the clubs that you may want to visit.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah, it's a very famous club in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: S- is it near to the first- the previous one.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Do you- the one in Chinatown.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Is this club near to that place or how can I get there from this club?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Now, you will have to %uh take a MRT.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And the closest MRT stop for you would be at this station called the %uh Tiong Bahru MRT train station.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh this is on the West Line.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So how many minutes would it take from-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Assuming that your hotel is located somewhere in %uh Orchard Road.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh it will take you approximately- %uh it's actually quite nearby but because there's no direct line from Orchard Road so you will have to %uh plan about %uh twenty minutes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Because you will have to change line.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So another %uh so the dress code, do you need to tell- to %uh- do you need me to tell you about dress code?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, it will be party wear.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you understand what I mean, right?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh so- So the clubs in Singapore also have dress codes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, another %uh club that I would like to introduce you would be this one that I'm going to show you now.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: What is the name of this club?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: This is quite a few clubs in there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's called Saint James Power Station.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So in one building, there's %hm a few clubs or several clubs in that building?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: There are few %uh different kind of clubs that you can see %uh in this power station.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's not used as a power station anymore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you have different themes in this %uh park so you can hop from one to the other.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So kind of bar hopping from one to another.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So- %uh yah, what I mean is you can go- if you don't like this club, you can go till then move on to the next one and the next one.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So this is in Saint James Power Station.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Hm I would also like to ask you about the gadgets in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh what sort of gadgets are you talking about?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Hm like places where I can buy gadgets.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh computers, laptop, so on and so forth?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Now this is one %uh %uh shopping complex %uh that you can %uh visit.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's called Funan DigiLife or Funan IT mall.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, this is the Funan IT mall.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The location is just near the- it's about seven minutes' walk from City Hall MRT.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So from my hotel, from there, I'm gonna have a little ride at MRT.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's quite convenient to ride the MRT %uh in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So %uh like I mentioned, this is near the City Hall MRT Train Station.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Oh and yes, we haven't %uh introduced you to any hotel yet.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So the IT mall, there are a number about five levels of shopping.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And these %uh every other shop sells IT related products.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: For example from cameras right up to laptops to accessories %uh can be found in this mall.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And it's all %uh IT related products in there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you can spend- up to you, you know, the- how many hours you take to find %uh the product that you wanted to buy.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Hm so now Lynnette %hm how about the accommodation or the hotel that I will-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: For the hotels in Singapore, they have various %uh ranges %uh in terms of price range.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So we have %uh let's say the three to the four star hotels %uh ranges from about hundred and fifty %uh onwards to about two hundred.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh and of course we have the three hundred to four hundred range and four hundred and above.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Or even the %uh what you call the value hotels, the budget hotels.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um budget hotels because I only have one thousand Singapore Dollars and there are three of us.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So- okay, I can give you these budget hotels.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: These are some of the budget hotels that we have in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay %uh one of the companies that runs these ho- budget hotels is called %uh Hotel Eighty One.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And they are pretty small hotel.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I mean the rooms are pretty small.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So this is nearer for you Dickson or Chinatown.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: There's also this budget hotel in Chinatown.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Hm is it a part of Chinatown or I will ride again?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh no. It's actually right in the heart of Chinatown.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But just bear in mind, the rooms are not that big.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So price range would be in the region of about a hundred and fifty.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So these are just some pictures of the-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So there are few %uh budget hotels located in Orchard Road.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Even this one at Beach Road.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So the hotels in Singapore are located- %uh most of the hotels in Singapore are located in Arch- it's- is it Archer Road, am I right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Orchard, O R C H A- Orchard Road, yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So quite a lot of hotels are located along Orchard Road.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But of course if you choose to live further away, there are also hotels available.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But because you are going to spend just a few days here so I would recommend that you stay closer %um around Chinatown.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You can stay in this %uh Beach Road area as well.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And this one, it's also okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But if you want to stay in Orchard Road, there are also other hotels out there as well.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Would you want to consider backpackers?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Hm I heard backpackers a lot so it's kind %uh %hm familiar hotel so I like that one.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Just now we mentioned about you like history, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Can I recommend you one hotel, budget hotel?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh that is located just right in the heart of another cultural area.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And this one- yah, this is called Sleepy Sam.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Hm so the budget hotel is near the cultural areas of Singapore or %uh another cultural area?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh just now I mentioned about the budget hotel like Hotel Eighty One.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you also mentioned about you like history.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So we already talked about Chinatown.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So that is the Chinese area.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So now I can recommend you an- %uh this is actually a backpackers' hotel and it's located in another cultural place called Kampong Glam.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Kampong is a Malay word, it means village and Glam is actually named after glam trees.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So there used to be a lot of glam trees that's found in this Kampong but no longer now.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: We only have a few of this glum tree that's left.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh this is the location of the %uh Sleepy Sam.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And the- it's %uh also near the MRT called Bugis.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So it will be a different kind of location from the Chinatown budget hotel.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: This one would be %uh in the so-called Malay and the Arab Quarters.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Hm so %um Lynnette %hm I would like to ask if %um is there %hm for the fee of a tour guide.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You can go to the guides online and you can call up the guides if you want to do a half-day tour.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh the charges depends, alright, on the guide.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh normally %uh the guides will charge like let's say %uh in the range of- from- for one person, two person, it doesn't matter.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, from the range of let's say- because this would be like a private basis or small group of people.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Um and if you are just talking about %uh walking tours %uh that- they will charge probably in the range of twenty five dollars per hour.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Hm so that's %hm- for example there are three of us.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So twenty five dollars per hour, am I right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So that would be about %uh- no, I mean like I said, it doesn't matter how many of you.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh it's- so yah, so approximately about twenty five dollars per hour.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, otherwise you can walk around on your own %uh if you choose to stay in Sleepy Sam.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh you are in the Malay Quarters so this is Kampong Glam and %uh Kampong Glam, as you can see from the left-hand side of-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: There is a picture of a mosque and this is called the Sultan Mosque.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: This picture will show you a street scene in %uh Kampong Glam.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh over here, of course, it's used to be the Malay Quarters.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You will find Malay cuisine out here.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So Malay cuisines are a little bit more spicy food compared to the Chinese food.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And do you want me to introduce you to some Malay food?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The Malay food %uh compared to the Chinese will be more spicy.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So we have like simple dishes called mee siam.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Mee siam is actually the small thin white noodles.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Um and we put in a sour kind of a sauce %uh together with this- with a hard-boiled egg.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh a little bit spicy. It's a little bit sour and spicy.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh a little bit spicy. It's a little bit sour and spicy.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Otherwise we do have also %uh another Malay food called %uh mee soto.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, mee siam- mee soto, it's a noodles with- cooked in %um chicken straps.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: With a little bit of soup.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Um not that spicy, just a tinge of spice.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh okay, so this will be Malay food.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Because I like spicy foods and I believe I will like it.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And there are also some %uh restaurants in %uh Kampong Glam.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh and they serve %uh rice with dishes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: We call it the Nasi Padang.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Nasi is %um a Malay word, it means rice.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, and you get to choose your dishes in %uh to go with your rice.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yup, so that's- there is a ri- that's a rice in a bowl or something like that.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, you get your rice and %uh you have this %uh dishes like for example, fried chicken %uh vegetables but of course they are spicy.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Um and %uh so that is %uh Malay food, yah, in %uh in Kampong Glam, Nasi Padang.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And also you can have another Malay food called %uh satay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, this food is %um %uh marinated meat.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You can have %uh chicken %uh mutton %uh marinated and they pierce through a skewer and it's barbecued over charcoal and you dip them with a peanut sauce %uh spicy peanut sauce.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So that is another very typical %uh Malay food in %uh where you can %uh find in %uh Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright, so this is Malay food.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh the other- and you can also even get Indonesian cuisine %uh over in Kampong Glam.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you have this like a smashed %uh chicken with rice.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, that you can also find in Kampong Glam as well as in other parts of Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Hm how about other cuisines that you have in Singapore or in that place?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: There are %uh mid-Eastern %uh cuisine that you can find in %uh Kampong Glam.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh even Mediterranean and there's even a Swedish cafe %uh that's found in Kampong Glam.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: It's- %Hm so it's a mix of different countries or restaurants from different countries.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh but in Kampong Glam, mainly it will be Malay cuisine and Indonesian I would say.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But like I said, there are some Arabic %uh Egyptian and Turkish %uh restaurants that's found in Kampong Glam itself.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Would you want to pay a visit to the mosque?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So again- yes, you ca- you are permitted to enter the Sultan Mosque in Kampong Glam.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And Lynnette, I have a question.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um are there people still worship in that mosque?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It is a living mosque so yes, people do visit the mosque to pray.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh the mosque will be crowded in the afternoon %uh on Friday.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh on other days %uh that would be fine.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But on Friday %uh they would not want to admit any %uh visitors %uh because they are going to have their prayers, the congregational prayers on Friday.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you are coming on the fourteenth, it's fine.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Fourteenth of May is actually Monday.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Hm are they all %hm still- I'm sorry.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Are there dress codes implemented in that mosque?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh all the places of worship %uh would have a dress code.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So again %um %uh pants must be below the knee.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh shorts or t-shirts %uh with the shoulders covered.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh otherwise if you are not so %uh properly dressed %uh the- %uh Sultan Mosque will provide a cloth %uh for people to wear tourists to put over their clothes %uh if they are not properly %uh covered up.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So we will pay for that-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh there is no admission to visit the %uh Sultan Mosque.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh but if you are non-Muslim %uh then we would not encourage you or we would %uh ask you to refrain from getting into the prayer hall.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So that is %uh the other- second culture that we're talking about %uh in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, we have another culture called the Indians.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So traditionally %uh these ethnic areas are where people used to live in the past.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So this Little India again, it is accessible by the subway.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So it's a place, Little India, am I right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I'm gonna show you some of the images here.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: This is %uh one of the street scene in %uh Little India.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Hm so these houses %hm what year they were built?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh which period of time they are built?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Like %um this one in the street.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh the year that they were built, is it?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Now Little India %uh would be in the range of about a hundred years old because they %uh came a bit later after the Chinese Quarters.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's member- %uh when everybody came here, they live in Chinatown area.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And it was very crowded so people started moving away.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So they would be in the range of about a hundred years %uh for Little India.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And %um what do you call %hm this transportation that- %uh these bikes?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, these %uh vehicles, we call them the trishaws.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You don't see %uh them plying %um the other parts of the street- %uh other parts of Singapore because they have designated %uh trishaws stations that these trishaws can park.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So it's not going to be very easy for you to flag a taxi %uh for example on an %um on other roads in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Would you be interested to get on one?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: These are just used for sightseeing purposes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh like I mentioned, the trishaw men can only ride on designated %uh roads in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you cannot tell him %uh I want to %uh go to Changi Airport, then that's not possible.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So designated area around the Chinatown or the %um %uh at

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah, Little In- yah, I'm sorry.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh Little India area %um as well as around the Padang area, that's about it for the trishaw ride.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So these were now used for sightseeing %uh purposes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And you have to get to the trishaw station %uh to get on to these trishaws.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Hm as- And they also have a station.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh the station %uh is %um located near Bugis %uh and you can see the trishaw there.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So- and this house is- they were around hundred years ago so this house is some kind of history for this place.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, so %uh I have introduced you- to you three of our main cultures %uh that we have here.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And thanks a lot and thank you for your help.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: We do have actually one more culture.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah we do have one more culture.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And that is located in the eastern part of Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay, let me see that one.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Are these %um- for example this Little India, the Chinatown %hm is it nearby to one another?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, they are quite near to one another.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh in the sense that %uh it's just about less than half an hour from one another %uh taking the MRT.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you would be able to get from one place to another within half an hour if you're going to use the MRT.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So the next %uh culture I'm going to introduce to you would be- it's easy for you to get to the museum called the Peranakan Museum.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Again, this is just near City Hall MRT.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And this group of people were originally Chinese people.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But %uh what they have done is %uh we call them the Straits borns So when they came to Singapore, the men first came and they inter-married with the local non-Malay lady- %uh the local %uh non-Muslim ladies.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And with it, finally they evolved their own culture called the Peranakans.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: S- So these people from China, they were married too?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, the men came from China and they inter-married with the local-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah, so this is a traditional dress.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: We call them- just now those ladies, they are wearing their kebayas.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So this will be the Peranakan Museum.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: In this museum %um are they still strict in dress codes?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh no. For the museum, it's okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh but of course, you know %uh no swimming attire.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So you can go like- just like shirts and shorts.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, you can wear shorts %uh if you want to go to the museum.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Hm are there shows or cultural shows in this museum?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh most of the time there will be no cultural show.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh but at %uh let's say certain events, yes, can- %uh there may be a show or a tour %uh for the museum otherwise %uh no. For the time of May %uh no, we don't have like any special %uh events that's going to come out.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So- So it's from Octob~Oct- I'm sorry, it's October till April, am I right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh no. It all depends on %uh whether- I'm talking about %uh event- %uh the museum would be on-going.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I don't think there's any special events coming out in %uh May.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes, so what month do you have for the events in that museum?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Usually %uh during school holidays, the museum have some %uh special events that's played.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay for the May thirteen, I guess you have not arrived.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah, this one is- it's for the children.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: They have this make a bouquet of flower, paper flowers %uh with %uh Peranakan motif.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright oh that will be for Mother's Day.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah, and otherwise the next event will be in June.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Because that would be the June school holidays in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So otherwise the museum, it's very nice to visit.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh lots of things to see, very different %uh culture from the other two cultures that I'm talking about.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So let's see any- there are- I think there's no special %uh events in the month of May except %uh for May the thirteenth where they have this children's workshop for Mother's Day.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Then yes, otherwise the on-going %uh exhibition will always be on-going so we always have the current %uh exhibition.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you will always see the current exhibitions and that's always on-going.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But in the Peranakan Museum collection.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Hm is it the clothes of the- it's woman?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh yes, we have %uh the kebaya collection.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But this one will end in eight of April.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You will still see some %uh small collection of kebayas.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh that's the traditional clothes of the Peranakans.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You will see a lot of %uh cutlery %uh crockery that were used by the Peranakan which is very different from the other two culture.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh and of course, you see like wedding %uh rituals %uh what do the Peranakans do?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh even in %uh death as well, funeral %um %uh yah, rituals.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: How do their house look like?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So basically that's what you're going to see in the Peranakan Museum.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's a very beautiful %uh very colourful %uh museum.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And Lynnette for the Peranakans %um what are- %hm what is the religion of this culture or this people?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, because they were originally Chinese men and they inter-married with local non-Malay- %uh non-Muslim ladies.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So they are still very much %uh traditionally.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh they are still very much %uh Buddhist.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But %uh along the way, quite a number of them had converted to Christianity.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So they actually mix %uh in their house, the traditional one.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh you still see Chinese altars %uh in the house.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And I'd like to thank you for this call and hope you had a good time.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Same to you and thanks for calling in.
